p: In recent years, more and more people from both developing and developed nations are moving towards herbal medicines as their choice for heath care since they are less expensive and have fewer side effects. Hence, there is a resurgence in the scientific research related to use of herbal extracts, isolation, and characterization of active principle(s) and understanding their mechanism of action in ameliorating diseases ( Hamdan and Afifi, 2004). Also, the study of plant extracts as protective (antimutagenic, antigenotoxic, and anticlastogenic) agents against environmental carcinogens, mutagens, and chemotherapeutic drugs has gained interest due to the presence of varied phyto-constituents such as flavonoids, alkaloids, coumarins, phenolics, etc. with a wide range of pharmacological properties.
